doc.after: The Northeast Pavilion houses a pedestrian entrance to the Millennium Park parking garage,[1] and provides access to the Harris Theater's rooftop terrace.[8][28] It is at 201 E. Randolph Street, east of the theater and west of the McDonald's Cycle Center. The pavilion's second floor has the Chicago Shop, which offers a self-guided Millennium Park audio tour for rental and sells official Millennium Park and Chicago souvenirs.[30] The two-story Northeast Pavilion is the second-largest, with 4,100 square feet (380.9Â m2) of surface area,[4] and also has 460 photovoltaic modules to generate electricity from sunlight.[1]
